prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with 0 degrees of rotation in all three axes and a translation vector of [0, 0, 0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create loop 1 consisting of 4 lines: 1. line_1: Starting at [0, 0] and ending at [0.75, 0] 2. line_2: Starting at [0.75, 0] and ending at [0.75, 0.6871] 3. line_3: Starting at [0.75, 0.6871] and ending at [0, 0.6871] 4. line_4: Starting at [0, 0.6871] and ending at [0, 0] Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.1328 units, creating part 1 with a height equal to half its width. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical hole Create a new coordinate system for part 2 using the values provided in the JSON file for the 'coordinate\\_system' section. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create loop 1 consisting of a circle with its center at [0.1594, 0.1594] and a radius of 0.1594. Extrude the sketch along the opposite normal vector by 0.2657 units. Using the 'CutFeatureOperation', remove a part of the solid to create a cylindrical hole. Part 3: Construct a tapered cylindrical top Create a new coordinate system for part 3 using the values provided in the JSON file for the 'coordinate\\_system' section. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Within this sketch, create loop 1 consisting of an arc and a line. 1. arc\\_1: Starting at [0, 0.1296], with a midpoint at [0.0787, 0], and ending at [0.1689, 0.122] 2. line\\_1: Starting at [0.1689, 0.122], ending at [0, 0.1296] Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.2657 units. Using the 'JoinFeatureOperation', add the new object to the solid by joining it to the previous part. Combine all parts to form the final 3D model resembling a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in one of its faces.</description>
